This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"closeLeveragedPosition(uint256)":{"params":{"minCollateralOut":"Minimum collateral to receive (slippage protection)"},"returns":{"collateralReturned":"Amount of collateral returned to user"}},"closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd(uint256)":{"details":"Use this if closeLeveragedPosition() fails due to swap issues.      User provides mUSD to repay debt, receives ALL collateral back.      This completely eliminates swap failure risk.","params":{"musdAmount":"Amount of mUSD to provide for debt repayment"},"returns":{"collateralReturned":"Amount of collateral returned to user"}},"emergencyClosePosition(address)":{"details":"Reordered: withdraw to contract \u2192 swap \u2192 repay \u2192 THEN return remainder to user      This prevents the user receiving collateral while still having outstanding debt","params":{"user":"The user whose position to emergency-close"}},"getMusdNeededToClose(address)":{"params":{"user":"The user's address"},"returns":{"musdNeeded":"Amount of mUSD required to repay debt and close position"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"openLeveragedPosition(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"collateralToken":"The collateral token (e.g., WETH)","initialAmount":"Initial collateral deposit","maxLoopsOverride":"Max loops for this position (0 = use default)","targetLeverageX10":"Target leverage \u00d7 10 (e.g., 30 = 3.0x, max based on LTV)"},"returns":{"loopsExecuted":"Number of loops completed","totalCollateral":"Total collateral after loops","totalDebt":"Total mUSD debt"}},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setMaxLeverage(uint256)":{"params":{"_maxLeverageX10":"Max leverage \u00d7 10 (e.g., 15=1.5x, 20=2x, 25=2.5x, 30=3x)"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."}},"title":"LeverageVault","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"closeLeveragedPosition(uint256)":{"notice":"Close leveraged position - repay debt and withdraw collateral"},"defaultPoolFee()":{"notice":"Default Uniswap pool fee tier (3000 = 0.3%)"},"disableToken(address)":{"notice":"Disable a collateral token"},"emergencyWithdraw(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emergency withdraw stuck tokens"},"enableToken(address,uint24)":{"notice":"Enable a collateral token for leverage"},"estimateLoops(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Estimate loops needed for target leverage"},"getEffectiveLeverage(address)":{"notice":"Calculate effective leverage for a position"},"getPosition(address)":{"notice":"Get user's current position"},"leverageEnabled(address)":{"notice":"Whether a collateral token is enabled for leverage"},"maxLeverageX10()":{"notice":"Maximum allowed leverage \u00d7 10 (e.g., 30 = 3.0x max)"},"maxLoops()":{"notice":"Maximum number of leverage loops per transaction"},"maxSlippageBps()":{"notice":"Slippage tolerance in basis points (e.g., 100 = 1%)"},"minBorrowPerLoop()":{"notice":"Minimum borrow amount per loop (prevents dust loops)"},"openLeveragedPosition(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Open a leveraged position with automatic looping"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pause all leverage operations"},"positions(address)":{"notice":"User leverage positions"},"setConfig(uint256,uint256,uint24,uint256)":{"notice":"Update leverage configuration"},"setMaxLeverage(uint256)":{"notice":"Set maximum allowed leverage (toggle between presets: 1.5x, 2x, 2.5x, 3x)"},"tokenPoolFees(address)":{"notice":"Per-token pool fee overrides"},"unpause()":{"notice":"Unpause leverage operations (requires admin for separation of duties)"}},"notice":"Automatic multi-loop leverage with integrated Uniswap V3 swaps. returns.collateralReturned: Amount of collateral returned to user

closeLeveragedPositionWithMusd(uint256).details: Use this if closeLeveragedPosition() fails due to swap issues.      User provides mUSD to repay debt, receives ALL collateral back.      This completely eliminates swap failure risk.

params.musdAmount: Amount of mUSD to provide for debt repayment

returns.collateralReturned: Amount of collateral returned to user

emergencyClosePosition(address).details: Reordered: withdraw to contract  swap  repay  THEN return remainder to user      This prevents the user receiving collateral while still having outstanding debt

params.user: The user whose position to emergency-close

returns.musdNeeded: Amount of mUSD required to repay debt and close position

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.maxLoopsOverride: Max loops for this position (0 = use default)
params.targetLeverageX10: Target leverage  10 (e.g., 30 = 3.0x, max based on LTV)

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

closeLeveragedPosition(uint256).notice: Close leveraged position - repay debt and withdraw collateral

enableToken(address,uint24).notice: Enable a collateral token for leverage

estimateLoops(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Estimate loops needed for target leverage

getEffectiveLeverage(address).notice: Calculate effective leverage for a position

leverageEnabled(address).notice: Whether a collateral token is enabled for leverage

maxLoops().notice: Maximum number of leverage loops per transaction

minBorrowPerLoop().notice: Minimum borrow amount per loop (prevents dust loops)

openLeveragedPosition(address,uint256,ui.notice: Open a leveraged position with automatic looping

setMaxLeverage(uint256).notice: Set maximum allowed leverage (toggle between presets: 1.5x, 2x, 2.5x, 3x)

unpause().notice: Unpause leverage operations (requires admin for separation of duties)
